Package ohos.hiviewdfx

Class Debug

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.hiviewdfx.Debug

  • public final class Debug
extends Object
    Provides debugging methods for applications, including obtaining statistics about tracing and memory data.

    This interface enables the debug mode for applications to obtain information such as the memory use and CPU time.

    Example code for starting the trace of a specified service flow by using the default trace flags: 

    
 long start = Debug.getCpuTime();
 ......
 int pss = Debug.getProcessPssSum();
    Since:
    2
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.HiviewDFX.Debug

      Enumerates memory types.

    • Field Detail

      • SHOW_CLASSLOADER

        public static final int SHOW_CLASSLOADER
        Indicates the flag for dumpLoadClasses(int) with information about classLoader included.

        Value: 0010

        When this flag is set, the list of loaded classes you obtained contains only classLoader information.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_FULL_DETAIL

        public static final int SHOW_FULL_DETAIL
        Indicates the flag for dumpLoadClasses(int) with details of loaded classes included.

        Value: 0001

        When this flag is set, the list of loaded classes you obtained contains all information about loaded classes: class names, classLoader, and class initialization statuses.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_INITIALIZED

        public static final int SHOW_INITIALIZED
        Indicates the flag for dumpLoadClasses(int) with information about initialization statues included.

        Value: 0100

        When this flag is set, the list of loaded classes you obtained contains only initialization statues.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRACE_COUNT_ALLOCS

        public static final int TRACE_COUNT_ALLOCS
        Indicates the flag for starting the tracing of method logs.

        Value: 0x0001

        When this flag is set, the memory allocations count is added to the trace file.

        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getProcessPss

        public static int getProcessPss​(Debug.MemType memType)
        Obtains the proportional set size (PSS) memory used by the current process.
        Parameters:
        memType - Indicates the memory type, which is enumerated in MemType.
        Returns:
        Returns the amount of used proportional set size (PSS) memory in KB.
        Since:
        2

      • getProcessPrivateDirtySum

        public static int getProcessPrivateDirtySum​()
        Obtains the total amount of private dirty pages used by the current process.
        Returns:
        Returns the total amount of private dirty pages in KB.
        Since:
        2

        Since:

        Parameters:

      • getIpcCount

        public static int getIpcCount​(Debug.IpcType ipcType)
        Obtains the number of IPC objects of the specified IPC type for this process.
        Parameters:
        ipcType - Indicates the IPC type, as enumerated in IpcType.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of IPC objects of the specified IPC type.
        Since:
        3

      • getIpcSentCount

        public static int getIpcSentCount​()
        Obtains the number of IPC objects sent by this process.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of IPC objects sent by this process if the operation succeeds; returns -1 if the operation fails.
        Since:
        3

      • getIpcReceivedCount

        public static int getIpcReceivedCount​()
        Obtains the number of IPC objects received by this process.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of IPC objects received by this process if the operation succeeds; returns -1 if the operation fails.
        Since:
        3

      • getMemoryStatistic

        public static String getMemoryStatistic​(String StatisticName)
        Obtains statistics about the memory of a specified name.
        Parameters:
        StatisticName - Indicates the name of the memory. The following memory names are supported:

        summary.java-heap

        summary.native-heap

        summary.code

        summary.graphics

        summary.private-other

        summary.system

        summary.total-pss

        summary.total-swap

        Returns:
        Returns the statistics about the memory (in KB) used by this process if available; returns null if no memory is obtained.
        Since:
        3

      • getMemoryStatistics

        public static Map<String,String> getMemoryStatistics​()
        Obtains the statistics about all memory used by this process. For details about the memory names, see getMemoryStatistic(java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        Returns the statistics about memory names/values in a map.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceBegin

        public static void functionTraceBegin​()
        Starts tracing function logs based on the default log file name (dmtrace.trace) and buffer size. The storage path is the default external storage directory.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceBegin

        public static void functionTraceBegin​(String traceName)
        Starts tracing function logs based on the specified log file name and the default buffer size (8 MB). The storage path is the default external storage directory.
        Parameters:
        traceName - Indicates the log file name. If this parameter is null, the default file name dmtrace.trace will be used.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceBegin

        public static void functionTraceBegin​(String traceName,
                                      int bufferSize)
        Starts tracing function logs based on the specified log file name and buffer size. The storage path is the default external storage directory.
        Parameters:
        traceName - Indicates the log file name. If this parameter is null, the default file name dmtrace.trace will be used.
        bufferSize - Indicates the buffer size in KB.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceBegin

        public static void functionTraceBegin​(String traceName,
                                      int bufferSize,
                                      int flags)
        Starts tracing function logs based on the specified log name, buffer size, and flag. The storage path is the default external storage directory.
        Parameters:
        traceName - Indicates the log file name. If this parameter is null, the default file name dmtrace.trace will be used.
        bufferSize - Indicates the buffer size in KB.
        flags - Indicates the trace flag. Currently, only TRACE_COUNT_ALLOCS is supported.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceSamplingBegin

        public static void functionTraceSamplingBegin​(String traceName,
                                              int bufferSize,
                                              int intervalUs)
        Starts tracing function logs in sampling mode based on the specified log file name, buffer size, and sampling interval.
        Parameters:
        traceName - Indicates the log file name. If this parameter is null, the default file name dmtrace.trace will be used.
        bufferSize - Indicates the buffer size in KB.
        intervalUs - Indicates the sampling interval, in microseconds.
        Since:
        3

      • functionTraceEnd

        public static void functionTraceEnd​()
        Stops tracing function logs.
        Since:
        3

      • dumpHeapFile

        public static void dumpHeapFile​(String fileName)
                         throws IOException
        Dumps a heap file into the specified file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Indicates the file name, including the file path, for example, /sdcard/dump.hprof.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the heap file cannot be dumped.
        Since:
        3

      • getRuntimeStatistic

        public static String getRuntimeStatistic​(String statisticName)
        Obtains the statistical information about the runtime of a specified name.
        Parameters:
        statisticName - Indicates the name of the runtime. The following runtime names are supported.

        gc.gc-count

        gc.gc-time

        gc.bytes-allocated

        gc.bytes-freed

        gc.blocking-gc-count

        gc.blocking-gc-time

        gc.gc-count-rate-histogram

        gc.blocking-gc-count-rate-histogram

        Returns:
        Returns the statistical information about the runtime for this process if available; returns null if the statistics cannot be obtained.
        Since:
        3

      • getRuntimeStatistics

        public static Map<String,String> getRuntimeStatistics​()
        Obtains the statistical information about all runtime used by this process. For details about the runtime names, see getRuntimeStatistic(java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        Returns the statistical information in a map storing runtime names and their corresponding data values.
        Since:
        3

      • connectToDebugger

        public static void connectToDebugger​()
        Connects this process to the debugger for entering the debug mode.
        Since:
        5

      • getDebuggerConnectStatus

        public static boolean getDebuggerConnectStatus​()
        Obtains whether this process has been connected to the debugger.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE if this process has been connected to the debugger; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isConnectingToDebugger

        public static boolean isConnectingToDebugger​()
        Checks whether multiple processes are waiting to connect to the debugger.
        Returns:
        Returns TRUE if multiple processes are waiting to connect to the debugger; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • getCountofLoadClasses

        public static int getCountofLoadClasses​()
        Obtains the number of classes loaded by this process.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of classes loaded by this process.
        Since:
        3

      • dumpLoadClasses

        public static void dumpLoadClasses​(int flags)
        Dumps a list of classes with a specific flag that are loaded by this process into a log file.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the flag of the loaded classes. The flag can be SHOW_FULL_DETAIL, SHOW_CLASSLOADER, or SHOW_INITIALIZED.
        Since:
        3

      • emulatorTraceBegin

        public static void emulatorTraceBegin​()
        Starts tracing emulator logs. This method is intended only for applications running in the simulator.
        Since:
        3

      • emulatorTraceEnd

        public static void emulatorTraceEnd​()
        Stops tracing emulator logs. This method is intended only for applications running in the simulator.
        Since:
        3

      • emulatorTraceEnable

        public static void emulatorTraceEnable​()
        Enables log tracing for the emulator. If you want to enable log tracing for a period time, call emulatorTraceBegin().
        Since:
        3

      • attachAgent

        public static void attachAgent​(String library,
                               String options,
                               ClassLoader classLoader)
                        throws IOException
        Attaches a library as the Java Virtual Machine Tool Interface (JVMTI) agent to the current runtime based on the given classLoader.
        Parameters:
        library - Indicates the path of the library to be attached.
        options - Indicates the options to be passed to the agent.
        classLoader - Indicates the class loader, which determines the library search path.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the agent cannot be connected.
        Since:
        3
